item.title: 别管关门了。投资者出现科技股反弹 FOMO
item.description:
投资者的目光已不再局限于美国经济的疲软和政府的僵局。【原文：

Investors are looking past a weakening economy and government gridlock in the US. 

】

item.title: 英国央行：英国企业预计将出现 2023 年底以来最严重通胀
item.description: 一项调查显示，英国企业预测未来一年的消费价格将以 2023 年以来最快的速度上涨，这可能会加重英国央行对通胀胶着的担忧。【原文：UK businesses predict that consumer prices will rise at the fastest pace since 2023 in the year ahead, according to a survey that’s likely to add to worries of sticky inflation at the Bank of England.】

item.title: 桑坦德银行计划设立基金，以利用重大风险转移热潮
item.description: 据知情人士透露，桑坦德银行（Banco Santander SA）正在筹建一个投资于重大风险转移的基金，因为该银行希望从对这种工具需求的激增中获益。【原文：Banco Santander SA is working on a fund that invests in significant risk transfers, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as the lender seeks to benefit from a surge in demand for the instruments.】

item.title: LG 能源开始将韩国电池工人送回美国
item.description: 在数百名员工因签证问题被扣留不到一个月后，LG 能源解决方案有限公司将开始派遣韩国员工返回美国进行必要的商务旅行。【原文：LG Energy Solution Ltd. will start sending workers from South Korea back to the US for essential business trips less than a month after hundreds of employees were detained in a visa crackdown.】

item.title: 碳捕集初创企业将项目从美国迁至加拿大
item.description:
由于有更好的激励措施和更稳定的监管环境，这家初创公司将项目北迁。【原文：

The startup building it moved the project north due to better incentives and what it views as a more stable regulatory environment.

】

item.title: 微软押注 330 亿美元开发 Nebius 等新云，以缓解人工智能紧缺问题
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，微软公司与新云公司 Nebius Group NV 达成的协议将为创建大型语言模型和消费者人工智能助手的内部团队提供计算能力。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s deal with neocloud company Nebius Group NV will provide computing power to internal teams creating large language models and a consumer AI assistant, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 美联储在抵御特朗普的孤军奋战中终于获得了一些支持
item.description: 面对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）日益加剧的攻击，美联储一直在为其独立性而斗争，但它并没有得到多少帮助&mdash；至少在本周之前是这样。【原文：As the Federal Reserve fights for its independence in the face of a mounting assault from Donald Trump, it’s not been getting much help — at least until this week.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克认为若无进一步冲击，利率将维持在 2
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克（Martins Kazaks）表示，除非经济再次受到冲击，否则央行可以维持利率不变。【原文：The European Central Bank can keep interest rates where they are unless the economy suffers another shock, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 土耳其预计将通过可控罚款解决银行与美国的争端
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士透露，土耳其预计将以一笔可控的罚款来解决与美国政府就国家贷款机构 Turkiye Halk Bankasi AS 违反制裁指控而产生的长期争端。【原文：Turkey anticipates settling a long-running dispute with the US administration over sanctions busting allegations against state lender Turkiye Halk Bankasi AS with a manageable fine, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Uniper 申请关闭德国重要储气库的许可
item.description: Uniper SE 已请求批准关闭德国最大的天然气储气库之一，因为该储气库未能达到今年的强制加气目标。【原文：Uniper SE has requested approval to shut one of Germany’s largest gas storage sites after failing to meet mandatory targets for refilling the facility this year.】

item.title: 对冲基金抛售期权，美国银行押注科技股反弹
item.description: 高涨的科技股正出现谨慎迹象。但美国银行的衍生品策略师说，这只会让使用期权押注这些股票进一步上涨的成本更低。【原文：Signs of caution are emerging around high-flying tech shares. But that’s just making it cheaper to use options to bet on further gains in the stocks, Bank of America’s derivatives strategists say.】

item.title: 顶级经纪人警告：英国应关注 "无情 "的并购浪潮
item.description: 根据经纪商 Peel Hunt Ltd. 的研究，英国决策者应该关注伦敦上市公司的收购数量，并需要采取措施支持该市场。【原文：UK policymakers should be concerned about the volume of takeovers of London-listed companies and need to take steps to support the market, according to research from broker Peel Hunt Ltd.】

item.title: 丹麦因税收红利丑闻损失数十亿美元而败诉
item.description: 丹麦税务机关在伦敦败诉，被起诉的数十家对冲基金和交易商利用复杂的税务交易骗取了约 120 亿克朗（约合 19 亿美元）。【原文：Danish tax authorities lost a London suit against dozens of hedge funds and traders who used complex tax trades to swindle it out of around 12 billion kroner ($1.9 billion).】

item.title: 人工智能狂潮推动科技股反弹，新兴股市跃升至 2021 年高点
item.description: 新兴市场股市连涨第四天，攀升至2021年以来的最高水平，原因是人工智能的乐观情绪— 受到具有里程碑意义的OpenAI股票出售的推动— 提升了全球情绪。【原文：Emerging-market equities extended their winning streak for a fourth day, climbing to the highest level since 2021 as artificial intelligence optimism — fueled by a landmark OpenAI share sale — lifted global sentiment.】

item.title: 据称 Stellantis 正在探索出售汽车共享业务 Free2move
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，Stellantis NV 正在酝酿出售其汽车共享业务 Free2move，因为首席执行官 Antonio Filosa 希望扭转这家濒临破产的汽车制造商的局面。【原文：Stellantis NV is mulling a potential sale of its car-sharing business Free2move as Chief Executive Officer Antonio Filosa looks to turn around the ailing automaker, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 云计算竞争加剧，亚马逊股票吸引力受挫
item.description: 近二十年来，亚马逊公司的云计算业务一直在推动其股价的增长，但来自微软公司和甲骨文公司等竞争对手越来越大的压力正在削弱该公司股票的部分吸引力。【原文：Amazon.com Inc.’s cloud-computing business has helped propel its shares for almost two decades, but increasing pressure from rivals like Microsoft Corp. and Oracle Corp. is sapping some of the stock’s appeal.】

item.title: Evolution 的亚洲合作伙伴失去博彩执照，股价下跌
item.description: Evolution AB 在菲律宾的业务合作伙伴被吊销了一个博彩执照，而在此之前不到三个月，两家公司合作推出了一个真人赌场工作室。股价下跌了近 6%。【原文：Evolution AB’s business partner in the Philippines has been stripped of one of its gambling licenses less than three months after the companies teamed up to launch a live casino studio. Shares fell nearly 6%.】

item.title: 中东未售出石油暗示全球石油供应过剩的早期迹象
item.description: 最近结束的交易周期中未售出的中东原油货物显示，有早期迹象表明，预期中的全球石油过剩可能开始出现。【原文：Unsold Middle Eastern crude cargoes from the recently wrapped up trading cycle are pointing to early signs that an expected global oil surplus could be starting to emerge.】

item.title: Monte Paschi 首席执行官认为继 Mediobanca 之后将有更多意大利银行交易
item.description: 意大利锡耶纳蒙蒂帕奇银行（Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA）收购竞争对手 Mediobanca SpA 可能标志着意大利银行业新一轮整合的开始。【原文：Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA’s purchase of rival Mediobanca SpA could mark the start of a new wave of consolidation for Italy’s banking sector, according to the executive who pulled off the deal.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯寻求废除外国股权投资者要求
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯建议放宽现有限制，向所有外国投资者开放股票市场，因为监管机构正努力促进资金流入该地区最大的市场之一。【原文：Saudi Arabia is proposing to open its equities to all foreign investors by easing existing restrictions, as the regulators seek to boost flows into one of the region’s biggest markets.】

item.title: 特里-达菲谈芝加哥商品交易所大力发展零售交易
item.description:
在 FanDuel 上进行市场投注。【原文：

Making market bets on FanDuel.

】

item.title: 部长称全球企业将与中国在津巴布韦能源领域展开竞争
item.description: 津巴布韦能源和电力发展部长七月-莫约（July Moyo）表示，美国和其他西方国家正在考虑投资津巴布韦的能源产业，该产业长期以来由中国投资者主导。【原文：The US and other western nations are considering investing in Zimbabwe’s energy industry, long-dominated by Chinese investors, Energy and Power Development Minister July Moyo said.】

item.title: 推动英国债券交易加速受阻于法律之争
item.description: 英国计划推出一个综合磁带，将其所有债券交易数据整合到一个单一的数据流中，从而使其在全球舞台上更具竞争力。【原文：The UK’s plans to launch a consolidated tape to bring all of its bond trading data into one single stream — making it more competitive on the global stage — have been put on hold.】

item.title: BBVA 排除了增资为任何新萨瓦德尔要约提供资金的可能性
item.description: BBVA SA 主席卡洛斯-托雷斯（Carlos Torres）誓言将为可能对 Banco Sabadell SA 的第二次竞购提供资金，而不会向投资者寻求新的资金。【原文：BBVA SA Chairman Carlos Torres vowed to fund a potential second bid for Banco Sabadell SA without tapping investors for fresh funds.】

item.title: 亚洲可转换债券在 9 月份创下反弹纪录
item.description: 受投资者对人工智能投资热情的推动，亚洲可转债市场在 9 月份创下了有史以来最强劲的月度表现。【原文：Asia’s convertible bond market posted its strongest monthly performance on record in September, buoyed by investor enthusiasm for artificial intelligence plays.】

item.title: 日本央行副行长在 Tankan 会议后重申加息立场
item.description: 日本央行副行长内田伸一重申了日本央行的一贯政策，即如果经济表现符合预期，将上调基准利率。【原文：Deputy Governor Shinichi Uchida reaffirmed the Bank of Japan’s standing policy to raise benchmark interest rates if the economy performs in line with forecasts, in comments a day after a key indicator showed business sentiment remains positive.】

item.title: 瑞典关闭 87 亿美元 AP6 基金引发出售担忧
item.description: 瑞典对其养老金制度进行了重大改革，但由于政府正在推进将养老金基金的数量从六个缩减到四个，因此引发了对其价值破坏的指责。【原文：Sweden’s major overhaul of its pension system has sparked accusations of value destruction as the government plows ahead with shrinking the number of AP funds to four from six.】

item.title: 诺和诺德所有者和丹麦政府支持 3 亿欧元量子基金
item.description: 诺和诺德公司（Novo Nordisk A/S）的所有者和丹麦政府成为新的主要投资者，他们表示，该基金将成为世界上最大的量子风险投资基金，以提升欧洲在技术发展中的地位。【原文：The owners of Novo Nordisk A/S and the Danish government are new anchor investors in what they say will become the world’s largest quantum venture fund, in a bid to boost Europe’s position in technological development.】

item.title: 亿万富翁的零食帝国将在俄罗斯法院下令后被查封
item.description: 据国际文传电讯社（Interfax）报道，在俄罗斯检察官声称亿万富翁丹尼斯-什滕格洛夫（Denis Shtengelov）的零食帝国向乌克兰提供支持后，莫斯科一家法院下令将其国有化。【原文：A Moscow court ordered the nationalization of billionaire Denis Shtengelov’s snack empire, after claims from Russian prosecutors that it provided support to Ukraine, Interfax reported.】

item.title: 投资者押注美联储减息，欧洲股市创历史新高
item.description: 欧洲股市延续了破纪录的涨势，因为在经济数据不乐观之后，投资者加大了对美联储降息的押注。【原文：European stocks extended a record-breaking rally as investors ramped up wagers on Federal Reserve interest-rate cuts following downbeat economic data.】
